intro: Trimorphandra pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly hairy texture. Trimorphandra pulchella is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
